title: Pork Lasagna
instructions: Heat the oil in a skillet and sauté the bacon and onion, and garlic for 5 minutes.  Add the pork and cook, stirring, until its browned.  Stir in the tomato paste, then the wine, water, seasoning, bay leaf and marjoram.  Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Place a layer of lasagna pasta in a buttered shallow oblong baking dish.  Top with a layer of meat, then some ricotta cheese.  Continue in this way, layering, ending with a layer of pasta.

Make the Béchamel sauce by melting the butter and stirring in the flour.  Cook the roué, stirring, for 1 minute.  Remove from the heat and gradually stir in the milk.  Add the bay leaf, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.  Cook over a gentle heat, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes.
Pour the Béchamel sauce over the lasagna.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and dot with the butter.  Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the topping is golden and brown.
source: Harrods Cookery Book by Marilyn Aslani, Arbor House, New York, © 1985 by Marilyn Aslani and the National Magazine Co. Ltd.
